==Eye on Asia== '''Eye on Asia'''<ref>[http://www.forbes.com/2009/07/24/grey-eye-asia-business-opinions-marketing.html]</ref><ref>[http://www.campaignindia.in/news/2009/11/04/asians-more-optimistic-grey-eye-on-asia-study]</ref><ref>[http://www.straitstimes.com/Breaking%2BNews/Asia/Story/STIStory_394882.html]</ref><ref>[http://www.prnasia.com/pr/09/06/09425311-1.html]</ref><ref>[http://www.youtube.com/user/greygroupasiapacific#p/u/56/VFGkkXUUnaw]</ref> is Grey Groupâs annual proprietary study that looks at the hopes and dreams of the [[Asia Pacific]] region, and determines the powerful underlying [[Fads and trends|trends]] that will shape [[brand management|branding]] and [[communications]] today and in the future. The [[research]] examines three areas of life for [[Asians]], namely [[lifestyle (sociology)|Lifestyle]], Present & Future Aspirations, and [[Consumerism]] & [[Communications]]. Recognised as an annual trends revealer, Eye on Asia aims to get closer to the people of [[Asia]], understanding what they want and expect from life, by exploring a broad range of topics, such as [[attitudes]] towards work, family, finance, the environment, and their value systems, as well as [[brands]] and [[marketing]]. Eye on Asia is a [[thought leadership]] initiative.
